data.name: Help.Arg.Identity
data.value: Specifies the identity of the application. This is used for the application and deployment manifest file names and the packge folder name.

data.name: Help.Arg.Source
data.value: Specifies the base directory for all source globbing patterns.

data.name: Help.Arg.Target
data.value: Specifies the directory to which ClickOnce packages will be published. If a relative path is specified, it will be relative to the source directory. This directory will be automatically excluded from all source globbing patterns.

data.name: Help.Arg.Source.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to the current directory.

data.name: Help.Arg.Identity.Create
data.value: If not specified, a name is inferred from the EntryPoint.

data.name: Help.Arg.Suite
data.value: Specifies the name of the suite to which the application belongs. If specified, this determines the folder on the Start menu where the application is located after deployment.

data.name: Help.Arg.Version
data.value: Specifies the version of the deployment. This need not be (and usually isn't) the same as the version of the application.

data.name: Help.Arg.Version.Create
data.value: If not specified, the version number of the EntryPoint is used.

data.name: Help.Arg.Description
data.value: Specifies a description for the application.

data.name: Help.Arg.Publisher
data.value: Specifies the publisher of the application. This name is used for the folder name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

data.name: Help.Arg.Publisher.Create
data.value: If not specified, a publisher is inferred from the EntryPoint.

data.name: Build.Exceptions.HelpText.NotFound
data.value: Help text not found

data.name: Help.Arg.Assemblies
data.value: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match assemblies to be included.

data.name: Help.Arg.CertificatePassword
data.value: Specifies the certificate password.

data.name: Help.Arg.CertificateSource
data.value: Specifies the source of the certificate to use for signing. If omitted, the ClickOnce package will not be signed. Must be either be a path to a .pfx file, or stored certificate in the form Type\StoreName\CommonName, e.g. 'User\My\Certificate'.

data.name: Help.Arg.CreateDesktopShortcut
data.value: Boolean. Specifies whether a shortcut to the application should be added to the user's desktop'. Has no effect if LaunchMode is 'url'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Culture
data.value: Specifies the culture of the application.

data.name: Help.Arg.DataFiles
data.value: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match data files to be included.

data.name: Help.Arg.UpdateUrl
data.value: Specifies the deployment and update location for the application. Required if UpdateMode is any value other than 'off'.

data.name: Help.Arg.EntryPoint
data.value: Specifies the application assembly that starts when the application is run.

data.name: Help.Arg.ErrorUrl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in dialog boxes during ClickOnce installation.

data.name: Help.Arg.Files
data.value: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match non-assembly files to be included.

data.name: Help.Arg.IconFile
data.value: Specifies the application icon file. This is used for the Start Menu and Add/Remove Programs dialog.

data.name: Help.Arg.LaunchMode
data.value: Specifies whether the application can be launched from the Start menu, from a URL, or both. Also allows browser-hosted deployments (Internet Explorer only).

data.name: Help.Arg.MinimumVersion
data.value: Specifies the minimum version the user must update to when starting the application. Has no effect is LaunchMode is 'url' or UpdateMode is 'none'.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsVersion
data.value: Specifies the minimum required operating system (OS) version required by the application. For example, the value '5.1.2600.0' indicates the operating system is Windows XP.

data.name: Help.Arg.PackageMode
data.value: Specifies which manifests to create.

data.name: Help.Arg.Platform
data.value: Specifies the target platform of the application.

data.name: Help.Arg.SupportUrl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box for the application.

data.name: Help.Arg.TargetFramework
data.value: Specifies the target framework of the application. Only .Net Framework targets net20 through to net48 are valid.

data.name: Help.Arg.TrustInfo
data.value: Specify trust information. Must be one of: 'full', 'intranet', 'internet', or a path to an XML file containing custom trust info.

data.name: Help.Arg.TrustUrlParameters
data.value: Boolean. Specifies whether URL query-string parameters should be made available to the application. Has no effect if LaunchMode is 'start'.

data.name: Help.Arg.UpdateMode
data.value: Specifies how application updates should be deployed.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseApplicationTrust
data.value: Boolean. Specifies which manifest should be used for trust decisions. If true, the Product, Publisher, and SupportUrl properties are written to the application manifest; otherwise, they are written to the deployment manifest.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseDeployExtension
data.value: Boolean. Specifies whether the .deploy file name extension mapping is used. If this parameter is true, every program file is published with a .deploy file name extension. This option is useful for web server security to limit the number of file name extensions that must be unblocked to enable ClickOnce application deployment.

data.name: Help.Arg.Culture.Create
data.value: If not specified, the culture of the EntryPoint is used.

data.name: Help.Arg.EntryPoint.Create
data.value: If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for managed executables. If exactly one is found, it will be assigned to be the entry point.

data.name: Help.Arg.IconFile.Create
data.value: If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for .ico files. If exactly one is found it is used; othewise, a default icon is used.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsVersion.Create
data.value: If not specified, the value is inferred from the TargetFramework.

data.name: Help.Arg.Platform.Create
data.value: If not specified, the target platform will be inferred from the EntryPoint. Note, setting this value can cause ClickOnce validation errors if the specified value does not match the entry assembly, therefore it is recommended to leave this option unset.

data.name: Help.Arg.TargetFramework.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to 'net472'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Quiet
data.value: Boolean. Displays only minimal information when the ClickOnce package is built.

data.name: Help.Arg.Verbose
data.value: Boolean. Displays extra information when the ClickOnce package is built.

data.name: Build.Banner
data.value: ClickOnce packager Copyright 2020 Andrew Mansell See license text for details (MIT)

data.name: Build.Args
data.value: Using the following project values:

data.name: Build.Args.CommandLine
data.value: Supplied as command line parameters:

data.name: Build.Args.Inferred
data.value: Inferred:

data.name: Build.Args.Settings
data.value: Supplied as settings (use clickonce configure to set):

data.name: Build.Exceptions.EntryPoint.Multiple
data.value: Unable to infer entry point, multiple .exe files found

data.name: Build.Exceptions.EntryPoint.None
data.value: Unable to infer entry point, no .exe files found

data.name: Build.Logging.Verbose
data.value: Verbose logging enabled

data.name: Build.Exceptions.Fatal
data.value: ERROR: {0}

data.name: Build.Verb.Create
data.value: Creating ClickOnce package from source directory '{0}'

data.name: Build.Process.Application
data.value: Processing application...

data.name: Build.Process.Deployment
data.value: Processing deployment...

data.name: Build.Process.EntryPoint
data.value: Adding entry point...

data.name: Build.Process.Glob.Adding
data.value: Adding {0}...

data.name: Build.Process.Glob.Skipped
data.value: [Skipped '{0}', not a managed assembly]

data.name: Build.Process.IconFile
data.value: Adding icon file...

data.name: Build.Process.Manifest
data.value: Manifest written to '{0}'

data.name: Build.Process.Project.Validating
data.value: Validating project...

data.name: Result.Done
data.value: done.

data.name: Result.NoneFound
data.value: none found.

data.name: Build.Exceptions.Arg.NotConvertible
data.value: Argument '{0}' value '{1}' is not convertible to {2}.

data.name: Build.Exceptions.Arg.NotFound
data.value: Argument '{0}' does not exist.

data.name: Help.Verb.Create
data.value: Create a ClickOnce package from scratch.

data.name: Build.Exceptions.VersionNumber.NotValid
data.value: '{0}' is not a valid version number

data.name: Help.Arg.ApplicationManifestFile
data.value: Specifies the name of the application manifest file.

data.name: Help.Arg.ApplicationManifestFile.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid file name, and should use a .manifest extension.

data.name: Help.Arg.ApplicationManifestFile.Create
data.value: If not specified, a name is inferred from the EntryPoint, e.g. 'MyApp.exe.manifest'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Culture.Constraint
data.value: Must be 'neutral' or a valid culture (e.g. 'en-GB').

data.name: Help.Arg.DeploymentManifestFile
data.value: Specifies the name of the deployment manifest file.

data.name: Help.Arg.DeploymentManifestFile.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid file name, and should use an .application extension.

data.name: Help.Arg.DeploymentManifestFile.Create
data.value: If not specifed, a name is inferred from the EntryPoint, e.g. 'MyApp.application'.

data.name: Help.Arg.EntryPoint.Constraint
data.value: Must be an .exe file targetting net20 onwards.

data.name: Help.Arg.IconFile.Constraint
data.value: Must be an .ico file.

data.name: Help.Arg.LaunchMode.Constraint
data.value: Must be one of 'start', 'url', 'both', 'browser'.

data.name: Help.Arg.LaunchMode.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to 'both'.

data.name: Help.Arg.MinimumVersion.Constraint
data.value: Must be a dotted version number with 1 to 4 elements, each less than 63356. Must be equal to or lower than Version.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsDescription
data.value: Specifies a description of the OsVersion.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsDescription.Create
data.value: If not specified, a value is inferred from the OsVersion.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsSupportUrl
data.value: Specifies a support URL for the OsVersion.

data.name: Help.Arg.OsVersion.Constraint
data.value: Must be a dotted version number with 2 to 4 elements. The first 2 elements must match a known Windows version (e.g. '6.0' for Windows Vista).

data.name: Help.Arg.PackageMode.Constraint
data.value: Must be one of 'none', 'application', 'deployment', 'both'.

data.name: Help.Arg.PackageMode.Create
data.value: If 'none', only validation of supplied arguments is performed. If not specified, defaults to 'both'.

data.name: Help.Arg.PackagePath
data.value: Specifies the path under the Target where the application package will be created. This should incorporate the Version number so that multiple versions can be published.

data.name: Help.Arg.PackagePath.Create
data.value: If not specified, a value is inferred from the EntryPoint, e.g. 'Application Files/MyApp_1_0_0_0'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Platform.Constraint
data.value: Must be one of 'AnyCPU', 'x86', 'x64', 'Itanium'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Target.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to 'publish'.

data.name: Help.Arg.TargetFramework.Constraint
data.value: Must be a net framework from 'net20' onwards.

data.name: Help.Arg.UpdateMode.Constraint
data.value: Must be one of 'none', 'starting', 'started', or a number of hours, weeks or days (e.g. '1w'). Only one unit can be specifed, and the interval cannot describe more than 1 year, regardless of unit.

data.name: Help.Arg.UpdateMode.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to 'none'.

data.name: Help.Arg.Version.Constraint
data.value: Must be a dotted version number with 1 to 4 elements, each less than 63356.

data.name: Help.Arg.CreateDesktopShortcut.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Arg.UpdateUrl.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

data.name: Help.Arg.ErrorUrl.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

data.name: Help.Arg.OsSupportUrl.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

data.name: Help.Arg.Quiet.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Arg.SupportUrl.Constraint
data.value: Must be a valid and absolute URI (a URL or a UNC).

data.name: Help.Arg.TrustUrlParameters.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseApplicationTrust.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseDeployExtension.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Arg.Verbose.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to false.

data.name: Help.Args.MinimumVersion.Create
data.value: If not specifed and UpdateMode is not 'none', defaults to Version.

data.name: Help.Arg.Product
data.value: Specifies the name of the product. This name is used for the shortcut name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

data.name: Help.Arg.Product.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to the Name.

data.name: Help.Verb.Configure
data.value: Configure default argument values.

data.name: Build.Exceptions.EntryPoint.Failed
data.value: Unable to add entry point

data.name: Build.Process.Launcher
data.value: Creating launcher app...

data.name: Build.Exceptions.EntryPoint.NotManaged
data.value: Entry point '{0}' is not a .Net Framework executable.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseLauncher
data.value: Specifies whether or not a launcher should be created. If 'auto', a launcher will be created if the EntryPoint is not a .Net Framework executable.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseLauncher.Constraint
data.value: Must be one of 'true', 'false', 'auto'.

data.name: Help.Arg.UseLauncher.Create
data.value: If not specified, defaults to 'auto'.
